2.text: “Can a man be of use to God? Can even a wise man benefit Him?

3.text: Does it delight the Almighty that you are righteous? Does He profit if your ways are blameless?

4.text: Is it for your reverence that He rebukes you and enters into judgment against you?

5.text: Is not your wickedness great? Are not your iniquities endless?

6.text: For you needlessly demanded security from your brothers and deprived the naked of their clothing.

7.text: You gave no water to the weary and withheld food from the famished,

8.text: while the land belonged to a mighty man, and a man of honor lived on it.

9.text: You sent widows away empty-handed, and the strength of the fatherless was crushed.

10.text: Therefore snares surround you, and sudden peril terrifies you;

11.text: it is so dark you cannot see, and a flood of water covers you.

12.text: Is not God as high as the heavens? Look at the highest stars, how lofty they are!

13.text: Yet you say: ‘What does God know? Does He judge through thick darkness?

14.text: Thick clouds veil Him so He does not see us as He traverses the vault of heaven.’

15.text: Will you stay on the ancient path that wicked men have trod?

16.text: They were snatched away before their time, and their foundations were swept away by a flood.

17.text: They said to God, ‘Depart from us. What can the Almighty do to us?’

18.text: But it was He who filled their houses with good things; so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.

19.text: The righteous see it and are glad; the innocent mock them:

20.text: ‘Surely our foes are destroyed, and fire has consumed their excess.’

21.text: Reconcile now and be at peace with Him; thereby good will come to you.

22.text: Receive instruction from His mouth, and lay up His words in your heart.

23.text: If you return to the Almighty, you will be restored. If you remove injustice from your tents

24.text: and consign your gold to the dust and the gold of Ophir to the stones of the ravines,

25.text: then the Almighty will be your gold and the finest silver for you.

26.text: Surely then you will delight in the Almighty and lift up your face to God.

27.text: You will pray to Him, and He will hear you, and you will fulfill your vows.

28.text: Your decisions will be carried out, and light will shine on your ways.

29.text: When men are brought low and you say, ‘Lift them up!’ then He will save the lowly.

30.text: He will deliver even one who is not innocent, rescuing him through the cleanness of your hands.”
